Nurlat (Russian: Нурла́т; Tatar: Cyrilli: Nurlat was formerly known as Nurlat-Oktyabrsky.It was founded in 1905 as a settlement around a railway station. Town status was granted to it in 1961.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
Latin Norlat) is a town in the Republic: Nurlat serves as the administrative center of Nurlatsky District
Russia: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
located on the Kondurcha River: is incorporated separately as the town of republic significance of Nurlat—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
268 kilometers (167 mi) southeast of Ka: the town of republic significance of Nurlat is incorporated within Nurlatsky Municipal District as Nurlat Urban Settlement.
